subject: Re: Redirecting Test Output
msgSnippet: You could redirect System.out and System.err to different print streams by using the functions System.setOut( new PrintStream() ); System.setErr( new
messageBody:
You could redirect System.out and System.err to different print streams
by using the functions

System.setOut( new PrintStream() );
System.setErr( new PrintStream() );

Checkout the JavaDocs at http://java.sun.com/j2se/1.4.2/docs/api/ for
more details.

You can tell the junit.textUi.TestRunner to write its results to a
different print stream by having a main program construct a TestRunner
like so:


public static void main (String [] args ) {
System.setOut(new PrintStream(new FileOutputStream("sysout"));
System.setErr(new PrintStream(new FileOutputStream("syserr"));
TestRunner runner = new TestRunner(new PrintStream(new
FileOutputStream("testRunnerOut") );
Test someTest = MyTestCase.suite();
runner.start( someTest );
}

Note the above is untested code intended to show what you can do if you
read the JavaDocs and
the JUnit code.

Erik Husby


[Non-text portions of this message have been removed]
